sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: An isosceles triangle has two sides of length 8 cm and a base of length 10 cm. Determine the length of the other two sides of the triangle.
message_2: Since the problem states that the triangle is isosceles and has two sides of length 8 cm, that means the other two sides are both 8 cm long. The base is given as 10 cm. So, the triangle has sides of length 8 cm, 8 cm, and 10 cm.
